headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; IMPORTANT FROM THE CAPITAL. Military Movements, Appointments, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. JoHN W. DAVIS has accepted the Governorship of Oregon. HIRAM POWERS, the sculptor, has been appoint. ed Commercial Agent of the United States at Florence. Four companies of the Eighth Infantry have been ordered to establish military posts opposite El Paso.

byline.original: By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times.Special Dispatch to the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Preparation for the next Congress--The Tariff-Hamburg Postal Treaty--Dr. Harris, of Department of Medicine in Naval Bureau, superseded--Other Naval Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is very little of interest stirring here at present,--the KOSZTA case, the Austrian Pronunciamento, and the war of the Shells in New-York, quite monopolizing public attention. The Executive Departments are all busily employed in getting up their back business and preparing for the approaching Session of Congress.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: FRANCE.; Imperial Editorial Tendencies--The Eastern Question--Dumas on Beranger--Interesting Suicide--Theatricals, Operas, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Moniteur states in a note, that notwithstanding the absence of the Chief of the State, the Ministers have several times met in council, at the department of Justice. What sorry conclaves they must have been. I have heard of the performance of "Hamlet," without Hamlet, but never without the first gravedigger.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: SUMMER LETTERS.; Letter Links between New-York and Virginia. NUMBER SEVENTEEN. How these Springs Acquired Character--Improvements--Society at the Red Salphur--Conversation--A Business Man and his Experiences-Virtue of Small Hominy--Reflections--Only one Nup.

docs.lead_paragraph: The reputation of these Springs is a debtor to deer and buffalo. It was one of their favorite "licks." and as their judgements are held to be extra debateable, the good people of the country were naturally inquisitive to find out the causes of their annual visitations. They began to use the waters for sundry affections, especially cutaneous diseases, and their simple minds were not slow to reach the acme of wonderment.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The Hard-Shells, or Terrified Democracy, held their Grand Ratification Meeting in the Park last evening. The meeting wes a very large one--numbering probably not less than ten thousand persons. The enthusiasm was very considerable, and the speakers were vociferously cheered. An un oward accident, by the falling of the platform produced an adjournment: at a somewhat earlier hour than was expected.
docs.abstract: Sp. at the Hard Ratification meeting

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC SIDE.; TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA. $2,436,109 IN GOLD DUST. The Packets of 1st September. ARRIVAL OF THE NICARAGUA STEAMER. Mining News Good---Markets Dull. FIERCE POLITICAL EXCITEMENT GENERAL NEWS. MINING ITEMS. The Southern Mines. Political Excitement. Civil Broil. The Crops. San Francisco Improving. State Printing Disclosures. Music and the Drama. FROM OREGON. Indian Troubles-A Battle. COMMERCIAL INTELLIGENCE. Tonnage, 1853--For Eight Months. Married. Died.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Nicaragua Transit Company's steamship Northern Light, Capt. THOMAS MINER, from San Juan del Norte, connecting on the Pacific side with the Brother Jonathan, from San Francisco Sept. 1, arrived at this port on Saturday evening, with 655 passengers, an independent mail, and a large amount of treasure on freight and in the hands of passengers.

headline.main: AID TO NEW-ORLEANS.; Mass Meeting of Printers at Tammany Hall. Ordination at Trinity Church--Sermon by Bishop McClasky.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of the practical Printers of New York, called for the purpose of resolving upon the best mode of affording relief to their fellow-tradesmen suffering from the epidemic in New Orleans, was held at Tammany Hall on Saturday Light.
docs.snippet: A meeting of the practical Printers of New York, called for the purpose of resolving upon the best mode of affording relief to their fellow-tradesmen suffering from the epidemic in New Orleans, was held at Tammany Hall on Saturday Light.

headline.main: PHILADELPHIA.; Health of Philadelphia--Yellow Fever on the Increase--Fires and Rowdy Fire Companies--A Conviction--Wm. B. Reed--Stock Market--Business Mutters, &c. &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of health, ill their weekly report of interments made last evening, state the number of deaths in the city and liberties to have been 201, of which 86 are adults and 115 children. The principal causes were 27 by consumption, 7 cholera infantum. 1O connvulsions, 11 dysentery. 11 marasmus, 6 typhoid fever, and 13 still-born.
